p: Of 130 HIV-uninfected, eligible adults, 123 (95%) enrolled in the trial and were randomized ( Fig 1): 74 (60%) to commitment contracts (38 and 36 in low- and high-value deposits, respectively), 25 (20%) to gain-framed incentives, and 24 (20%) to no incentive. Among commitment contract participants, 69/74 (93%; 95% confidence interval [CI]: 85â€“98%) adults provided an initial deposit: 36/38 (95%) in low-value and 33/36 (92%) in high-value groups ( Table 1). Of the five participants who declined to deposit, reasons given included fear of losing the deposit (N = 2), and inability to afford the deposit amount (N = 3). Among the no incentive group and the gain-framed incentive group, 96% (23/24) and 92% (23/25) reported a willingness to provide a commitment contract deposit if offered, respectively.
